item.name: Anti-Matches
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A box of matches.
{@bold Features} (GM): Striking one will make it begin to drip water from the tip while the match shrivels away. The amount of water a match releases is about enough to fill a tablespoon.

item.name: Arrow of Euarere
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing):  A silver arrow, suspended on a string.
{@bold Features} (GM): It always points to the person holding the string.

item.name: Attentive Guardsman's Tabard
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A dozen of these tabards were fashioned for palace guardsmen in the Empire of Sard, 250 miles from the nearest enemy. The bearer is placed under a glamor that causes him to appear alert and awake, even if his eyes are closed and he is snoring lightly.

item.name: Arcanus Glasses
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Black thick rimmed spectacles. Gives the wielder +1 to any roll against an enemies AC while using a ranged spell and adds +1 to the wielders spell DC.

item.name: Artist's Bludgeon, The
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Inanimate objects hit with this bludgeon will receive no damage; they will however change color.

item.name: Attentive Guardman's Pike
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): These ornate and deadly-looking ceremonial pikes are reach weapons and appear to weigh at least 20 lbs, not counting the weight of the fluttering banners that can be unfurled for parade use. Constructed of shadowstuff, they weigh one pound, and inflict only a single point of damage on an attack, being almost entirely for show, although they also have the unique property of remaining in place when set (although unable to support more than 20 lbs), allowing a 'resting his eyes' guardsman to prop it up and leave it standing under its own power, while his hand sags off of it.

item.name: Axe of Big Numbers
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This axe shouts “Big numbers baby, come on!” whenever it is swung, but always deals 1 damage or less. It however does count as a magical item (Disadvantage on stealth while wielding; Disadvantage on Attacks).

item.name: Amulet of Feather Fall
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When worn, this amulet turns into a feather and falls to the ground.

item.name: Amulet of Teenage Awkwardness
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This amulet is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by the remove curse spell or similar magic. You are able to remove the amulet once the curse is lifted.  While wearing this amulet, you are unable to speak clearly to a humanoid of the opposite sex. Your words come out garbled and only somewhat comprehensible. Any verbal spell attacks against a humanoid of the opposite sex are made with disadvantage.

item.name: Amulet of Sleeplessness
item.curse: It could be stated as cursed.
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When worn, the wearer no longer sleeps. If Identified the magical item states it removes the need for sleep. Each day the wearer doesn't sleep it takes another attunement slot, even if another device competes. When no slots are left, it stops working the wearer takes 3 levels of exhaustion and an additional each sleepless day thereafter.

item.name: Amulet of Inedibility
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Shiny salmon colored amulet. Any creature wearing this amulet will appear inedible to carnivores who fail a DC 18 WIS save.

item.name: Bottomless Beer Mug
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Any liquid poured into this mug treats the bottom as incorporeal, but solid objects don't.

item.name: Bag of Beholding
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): See {@item Bag of Holding}

{@bold Features} (GM):  Identifies as a bag of holding type II-V, but actually only holds as much as the type below it. In addition, when you pull an item from the bag, it emits a golden beacon, and a booming voice proclaims “Behold, ” and makes up a name and description for the thing you pull out while accompanied by an angelic choral backup. Like, you go to pull out a pair of socks, and the thing will go “BEHOLD THE STOCKINGS OF INEVITABLE GLORY, KNIT BY LACHESIS UPON THE LOOM OF DESTINY FOR MIGHTY IOMEDAE ON HIGH AND BLESSED WITH THE GIFT OF ETERNAL SELF-DARNING” when it was something her grandmother cut from sack cloth.

item.name: Bag of Berries
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing):  This burlap bag looks large enough to hold a coconut; it's smooth to the touch and is always found in the color purple with a golden strap.

{@bold Features} (GM): Once-to-three-times per day anyone can place their hand in the bag to pull out a handful of berries or other fruit -- this magical fruit is highly nutritious, able to keep your hunger at bay for a full 16 hours. Rare(twice per day)

item.name: Barrel of Holding
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This large wooden barrel measuring √(12/π) feet in diameter and 5 feet in height can hold up to 15 cubic feet of matter.

item.name: Bag of the Magi
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This small red/burlap bag has a picture of a star stitched into it.

{@bold Features} (GM): A spellcaster who sticks her hand into the bag may pull out a small metal sphere. When clenched tightly in the spellcaster's fist, it will empower the spellcaster – you receive a +1 bonus to any spell attack roll. At 6th level and every 6 spellcaster levels thereafter, this bonus increases by one (to a maximum of +4 at 18th level). Once used, the sphere will magically disappear. If a sphere is removed from the bag and not used within 5 minutes, it will also magically disappear (even if it is placed back into the bag). The bag only holds up to two spheres at a time, and the bag itself produces new spheres at the rate one every other day.

item.name: Bag of Trading
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): You can take one thing out of the bag for each object you put in the bag. However, you have no control over what you get, and there are no trade-backs. Past research seems to imply there's some sort of correlation to what gets you what, but it's extremely convoluted and far from understood.

item.name: Barry’s Pocketwatch
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A bronze timepiece with a foreign, almost futuristic design.

{@bold Features} (GM): You may activate this item by opening it as an object interaction and give yourself 1 Action Surge. This effect cannot be used again until you have completed a long rest. It has a 1 in 10 chance of breaking when used.

item.name: Bag of Faerie Gold
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This sack appears to be full of gold coins and jewels.

{@bold Features} (GM): When one attempts to spend them, however, the glamour on them soon vanishes, revealing them to be nothing but leaves and pebbles. Obviously, most shopkeepers will not be happy about this, and no amount of 'we didn't know, I swear!' will change their mind.

item.name: Bag of Folding
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This sturdy cloth bag is made of high quality cotton, adorned with exotic feathers and sometimes pretty cross stitches.

{@bold Features} (GM): The bag itself is treated as a standard backpack that can hold up to 5lb of material. However, this magical bag has the magical ability  to be flattened and folded as if it were empty - even if the bag is full. The bag can fold down to 1/5 of its normal size, but its weight and mass will not change. The bag cannot be opened when folded this way, but it can be ruptured -- if ruptured (while folded) it will cause a small rift, causing it to explode for 3d8 damage (bludgeoning) to anyone within 10 feet of the explosion.

item.name: Beggar's Noose
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A noose. Old, and weathered with a thick knot and 4 feet of slack rope which fades into nothing.
{@bold Features} (GM): It gives a +5 (20%) to all loot rolls but everytime it's used it tightens around the users neck until it chokes them to death.

item.name: Bag of Trick
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A old leather pouch.
{@bold Features} (GM): This bag operates like a Bag of Tricks, except it only works once a week and produces a rat each time it is used.

item.name: Bag of holding (Belt Pouch)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A leather belt pouch.

{@bold Features} (GM): This is a belt pouched size bag which appears to be of common cloth, 4inches by 6 inches in size. The bag opens a pocket dimensional space.  The bag weights 2lb but may carry up to 8cubic feet, or 125lbs of materials.  The bag opens to new pocket dimension for each person that uses it. It however can never hold more than a total of 250lbs or else it will eject the oldest entries.

item.name: Bag of holding (Sack)
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This is a sack size bag which appears to be of any number of colors and quality of cloth or leather, is measures 30 inches at the opening and 4 feet in length. The bag opens to a pocket dimensional space.  Regardless of what is inside of it, the bag weights 25lb but may carry up to 216 cubic feet, or up to 1250lbs of materials.

item.name: Bag of Unholding
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Quite a large backpack but even the smallest item doesn't fit.

item.name: Bag of holding (Satchel)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A stachel of cloth or leather.

{@bold Features} (GM): This is a shoulder satchel bag which appears to be of worn leather and is worn, 18 inches by 22 inches in size. The bag opens to a pocket dimensional space.  The bag weights 10lbs but may carry up to 64 cubic feet, or 250lbs of materials

item.name: Bag of Holding (v1)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A sack that has the pattern of a sad face worked into the leather.

{@bold Features} (GM): Once this sack is attunded the face appears to be happy. An audible contented sigh will be heard whenever the bag is in hand. If it becomes unattuned, the face becomes sad again.

item.name: Bag of Holding (v2)
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This item functions as a normal backpack, however when attempting to retrieve an item, a calm female voice tells them there is a wait time of 4d10 minutes before they can retrieve their item. During this wait, the bag plays either annoying muzak or advertisements for the bag's creator's other products/services. Upon attempting to retrieve an item, there is a chance that the wrong item is retrieved, or that the intended item is simply missing. Obtaining the original item requires an additional 4d10+6d6 minutes and has only a 5% chance of success.

item.name: Black Serpent Tattoo
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing):  A black tattoo with a snake-like design that goes around the wrist.

{@bold Features} (GM): Holds 3 charges. As a bonus action the wielder may spend 1 charge to make their next unarmed attack deal an extra 1d10 acid damage. A creature previously hit by an attack from this item makes a CON save against the wielders spell DC, and again at the end of each of their turns. Upon a failed save, the creature becomes poisoned. Upon a pass, the creature reverts to normal status. This item regains its charges at dawn the next day.

item.name: Bottomless Bottle (Mug)
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Any liquid poured into this mug treats the bottom as incorporeal, but solid objects don't

item.name: Balls of Eyes
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A snow-globe filled with miniature eyeballs.
{@bold Features} (GM): When shaken, it grants the user a blurry, jittery vision of some future event.

item.name: Bloody Quill of the Imposter
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This is the perfect item for the sneaky fraudster, blackmailer, or imposter. It appears to be an intricate but normal looking quill pen, but when blood is placed in the ink well, it allows the writer to perfectly impersonate the person from whom the blood belongs.

The quill will not only perfectly impersonate the handwriting of the victim, but also the mannerism in which they talk, including but not limited to any spelling mistakes they tend to make, any colloquialisms they frequently use, or any other way that a reader could identify the author. The blood is changed to the appearance of whatever ink the victim usually uses.

The user of the quill still has complete control over what is written, but writing in the hand and voice of the victim seems completely natural while using the quill and blood ink. The victim would even find themselves questioning whether they wrote anything that was written by this pen, and magical means would be required to determine the forgery.

item.name: Bartender's Friend
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A Mug or Cup.

{@bold Features} (GM): This is a cup, mug or keg that can magically heat or cool its contents. It can also be commanded to stir or mix a drink. If a few drops of non-magical liquid is is in it, it can be commanded to fill itself to the brim with that drink. It can only generate one gallon of liquid per day in this manner.

item.name: Bountiful Spade
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Characters who use this enchanted farm implement to turn over the earth prior to planting a field receive the effect of Plant Growth - doubleing the yield of the field and reducing the period to produce the yield by 10%.

item.name: Bowl of Comfortable Warmth
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Any liquid in the bowl will feel comfortably warm, so icy cold water will feel like it's a bit over room temperature. Do note, however, that it's still icy cold water, it just feels warmer.

item.name: Beholder Tooth Water Pipe
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A bubbler made from the fang of a beholder.
{@bold Features} (GM): Inspires the wielder to be more insightful. Adds +2 to insight. You can sacrifice 10 HP to add an extra +3 to an insight check when using this item.

item.name: Bedpan of Teleportation
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The contents of this pan are taken to a tear into an extradimensional place. (acts as a bag of devouring)

item.name: Boogie Skeleton
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This pile of bones is small, such as one that might be obtained from a bird or a toad, though it can look as though it came from any creature.

{@bold Features} (GM): When a song is sung or played in the vicinity of the skeleton, it begins to dance appropriately. As soon as the music stops, it collapses into the pile of bones again. The skeleton, when dancing, can be no larger than Diminutive.

item.name: Box of Mild Interest
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): If this box is held in two hands and shaken, taking a standard action, it may generate an effect (all spell effects are CL 3). Roll 1d20.

entries.caption: Mild Results
rows: {@spell Hold Person} on the closest non-using creature
{@spell Dancing Lights} as desired by the holder
{@spell Sleep} on a creature of the holder’s choice
Holder takes 1 force damage, no save

item.name: Bag of Holding (v3)
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This will appear as a bag of holding, even under an idenitify. However its more like a bag of devouring, as wealth deposited doesn't necessarily remain, the pocket dimension is connected to a specific shared location.. a room in a powerful rogue's guild who has seeded these bags out into the world so that they can passively pick pockets of those who use it. The GM can determine the Rogue guild's informatoin, who (or what resides there) as  Since it is not a true bag of holding, a creature may enter the bag and pass through the portal and be teleported to the thief’s stronghold.  While holding this bag, you are compelled to place all of the treasure the party finds in this bag. In addition, the bag is always in your possession and you will not want to give it away, sell it, or leave it. The curse remains in effect until you are targeted by the remove curse spell or similar magic.

item.name: Bag of Marbles
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A full bag heavy with its contents that clinks.
{@bold Features} (GM): The bag may produce up to 1000 marbles a day, in lots of 10d10 (10-100).  All marble produced this way disolve the next day.

item.name: Bracers of Attraction
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When worn the wearer must make a Contested Athletics/Strength check (DC 18) or have their arms bound together, and will be unable to use somnatic components and attacks are at a disadvantage.

item.name: Bracers of the Four Winds
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): These ancient bracers are adorned with far eastern lettering.

{@bold Features} (GM): When worn, you gain fast reflexes in an every changed combat situation. When an opponent misses its melee attack against you, as a reaction action you can make a powerful palm attack to blow your opponent back. This attack deals no damage, but on a successful hit the target is sent back 5-feet in the opposite direction of you. You can only make this attack if you are not wielding a shield.

item.name: Boots of Blinding Speed
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): +25 ft per round. Also makes wearer nearly blind (half vision). -10 penalty for all checks where sight could be needed.

item.name: Boots of Fire
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): These stylish red leather boots often come with fringe and sometimes a red gem.

{@bold Features} (GM): When worn, you can take an action once per day to stomp your foot on the ground, to send bolts of mystical fire all around you -- all creatures within 5-feet of you, including yourself, are dealt 1d4 or 2d4 fire damage (Dexterity save for half damage, DC 12). However, you have Advantage when attempting this save, and if you are successful, you take no fire damage at all from this effect.

item.name: Chronomantic Focus
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Using an action to flip the hourglass, you can rewind time to the beginning of your last turn. Everything is as it was at that moment, except you remember the would-be future and the hourglass remains flipped.

item.name: Cup of Everlasting Whine
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This golden cup has etchings of frogs and salamanders on the outside, while the inside is silver in color.

{@bold Features} (GM): Whenever you drink any liquids from the cup, you gain a sense of courage -- you are granted a +2 bonus to all charisma based checks. However, after 24 hours, the bonus completely fades and become agitated at all things around you -- you receive a -2 penalty to charisma until the cup can be destroyed. The cup can only be destroyed by wrapping it in banana leaves and boiled in oil for one hour.

item.name: Crown of Lords
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see makes a saving throw against being frightened, as a reaction you can attempt to encourage the creature. If the creature can hear and understand you, the creature gains advantage on the roll. Crown of Lords has 4 charges. Using an action you can spend 1 charges to cast the (DC 15) command spell through the crown. The crown regains 1d4 charges at dawn.

item.name: Necromancer's Saddle
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Black leather saddle with streaks of red through the leather itself.

{@bold Features} (GM):  A small amount of black smoke emanates from the saddle when it is holding still. (You can use an action to place this saddle on the corpse or skeleton of a Large creature and animate it as an undead mount. The undead creature's bones shift as necessary to create something similar to a warhorse skeleton (MM 273), which follows your mental commands as long as you are riding it. The effect lasts until you remove the saddle, or until the next dawn. When the effect ends, the undead creature crumbles into dust.)

item.name: Nothing
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This common stone appears mostly unremarkable, save for its exceptionally smooth, almost polished surface.

{@bold Features} (GM): A single creature that is touching the stone or carrying it on their person emits no sound whatsoever, including speech, footfalls, and even contact with other surfaces or objects. Additionally, the stone has an AC of 17, and if it is targeted by an attack that deals at least 10 damage (vulnerable to thunder and bludgeoning), it shatters, spreading silencing dust in a 5 foot radius sphere centered on the stone. Each creature in this area must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw (willing creatures can choose to fail this save) or be silenced for 1 hour, until they are targeted by a dispel magic spell, or until they are doused with water.

item.name: Orb of Finding
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A perfectly smooth blue sphere roughly 5 inches in diameter.

{@bold Features} (GM): While holding this when the user concentrates on any object, person, or character, and the orb will rotate to face it. Markings cannot be made on the Orb, nor can anything be attached to it.

item.name: Orb of Stein Rune
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This orb of granite is about the size of an adult human's fist.

{@bold Features} (GM): The stein (stone) rune appears on it in the form of crystalline veins that run across the surface. The orb has the following properties, which work only while it's on your person. Indomitable Stand. As an action, you can channel the orb's magic to hold your ground. For the next minute or until you move any distance, you have advantage on all checks and saving throws to resist effects that force you to move. In addition, any enemy that moves to a space within 10 feet of you must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be unable to move any farther this turn. Stone Soul. You can't be petrified. Earthen Step. You can cast meld into stone as a bonus action. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. Gift of Stone. You can transfer the orb's magic to a nonmagical item—a shield or a pair of boots—by tracing the stein rune there with your finger. The transfer takes8 hours of work that requires the two items to be within 5 feet of each other. At the end, the orb is destroyed, and the rune appears in silver on the chosen item, which gains a benefit based on its form: Shield. The shield is now a rare magic item that requires attunement. While you wield it, you have resistance to all damage dealt by ranged weapon attacks. Boots. The pair of boots is now an uncommon magic item that requires attunement. While you wear the boots, you have advantage on Strength saving throws, and you can use your reaction to avoid being knocked prone.

item.name: Potion of False Life
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This blue potion bubbles and steams as if boiling.
{@bold Features} (GM): For 1 hour after drinking it, you gain 10 temporary hit points that last for 1 hour.

item.name: Purr Toys
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): These soft toys are always cats of various breeds and colourations, with soft fur. When held by a character during a short rest, the toy animates, curling up into the character's lap and purring. As well as being inherently soothing, if the user expends any Hit Dice during the rest, the first die they roll is treated as rolling the maximum result.

item.name: Passkey
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This key can be used to open any lock that accepts a key.

item.name: Pick Axe of Building
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This is a magical pick axe, which seeks to hewn from the earth structures - it has the ability to effectively 'mold earth' every 10 minutes. Rock is harder but it can effectively take 1 hour to use stone shape.  HOWEVER using any of these abilities you must make a Wisdom Save DC 14; for every ten minutes of use of the Pick Axe for building.  Failure means you spend the next hour building a random dungeon structure (room, corridor, stairwell etc) (See DMGs guidance on random Dungeon Layouts); after which you must Wisdom save again DC 18 or continue to build.  Each 8 hours of work without rest will lead to another level of exhaustion.

item.name: Pants of Doom!
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): These leather pants are often found in the most peculiar color of green, and always with a belt adorned in leaves.

{@bold Features} (GM): When worn, it will detect whenever you are in danger; if you are surrounded by 3 or more hostile enemies (each must be within 10 feet of you), the pants will automatically release a vile stench deals 1d6 points of Poison damage to all creatures within 10 feet (friend or foe). After it has released the stench, it will not do so again until you havetaken a short rest.

item.name: Potion of Polymorphing
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When poured out of its flask, turns into a random nonmagical item weighing up to 1 lb, and worth no more than 20 gp.

item.name: Perception Boots
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Designed by the great thief/mage, Thomas Archfield, these black boots have Thomas' seal on the bottom of the soles, but otherwise they are not stylish in any way. When worn it gives you a +2 bonus to all perception checks for detecting traps, but only traps that are activated when stepped on. When worn by a Rogue that is level 3 or higher, this perception bonus is doubled

item.name: Potion of Infertility
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This clear potion holds twenty-eight tiny white beads suspended within it, all of which dissolve as the potion is consumed.

{@bold Features} (GM): After you drink the potion, you become incapable of siring or conceiving offspring for 1 year. Drinking the potion has no effect on offspring already conceived at the time it is consumed.

item.name: Pick of Prospecting
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This weapon resembles a finely made war pick with a gleaming blue sapphire set at the point where the head and shaft meet. When wielded in battle, the war pick feels preternaturally light and agile, but this does nothing to reduce its ability to cause grievous injury. The pick also has the power to locate undiscovered mineral wealth when in the hands of a dwarf

{@bold Features} (GM): Property: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this weapon. When used by a dwarf, the pick can produce an effect similar to the 4th-level spell locate creature. However, instead of a living creature, the pick detects the direction of a single type of unworked precious metal or gemstone (silver, gold, sapphires, etc.) chosen by the wielder. The owner senses the direction of the chosen type if within 1,000 ft. of his present location. Worked or fashioned metals or gems (gold coins, silver chalices, cut diamonds, etc.) are not detected by the pick. This power may be used once a day and lasts for 1 hour.

item.name: Quill of Death
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This quill is made of a peacock feather and never needs ink to write. By holding the quill in the air and spelling out a magical word of power, the word will form into a solid object and launch itself at any creature within 40 feet (make a spell attack roll). (d8+Spell Modifier damage, the type of damage deteremined by the wielder may choose Bludgeoning (Noun), Piercing (Verb), or Slashing (Adjective)

item.name: Quill of Scribbling
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Looks like and identifies as a quill of spell copying, but when you use it is destroys the spell scroll and scribbles all over the two new scrolls instead of writing the spell on them.

item.name: Scroll of Underwater Breathing
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When unrolled underwater it quickly re-rolls itself and contracts into to a slender bamboo shoot the length of a man’s arm. It is hollow, and while very narrow the user will find they can breathe through it as if it isn’t even there. The scroll will remain in this form for the next hour during which for all intents and purposes it is a length of bamboo. At the end of the hour it will collapse into a soggy sheet of parchment. DM’s note: It does not grant waterbreathing. It is a snorkel.

item.name: Shadow Semblance Hairband
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Black hairband with cat ears.

{@bold Features} (GM): Once per day, when the wielder of this item is hit by a critical hit, they may use a reaction to activate this item. When activated, the wielder teleports to the space behind the attacker and the place they previously occupied is replaced with an identical shadow clone with 1HP. The shadow clone takes the critical hit in place of the wielder, and the wielder may make an attack of opportunity as a free action.

item.name: Shit Sack
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This bag is essentially a bag of devouring, it is ALWAYS clearly marked, and ALWAYS one directional.  The sack rarely will not smell of excrement and urine. When someone uses it for either purpose it places their waste in a pocket dimension, which seems to never overflow. ((In reality it dumps it somewhere designed by the bag's creator... why!?  well that's a tale for the bold and those bereft of smell to explore))

item.name: Soar Board
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This is a surfboard. I could be clever and descriptive about its appearrance, hinting about its enlongated and organic form, likening it to stone, but barely of weight. But, its a surfboard so I'll leave it at that. This requires a Vehicle (board) check to ride it. Difference is that you can fly with it at 20ft a round, modified by wind speeds.  Gaining or Losing altitute requires a bonus action and a Vehicle (board) check equal to the number of feet you are losing or gaining that round.

item.name: Short Sword of Jack Frost
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): the sword radiates magic but when used by a class that can use a sword, it seems to do nothing special. If the item is ever handled by a cleric, magic user, or one of their sub-classes, this individual does whatever they can to retain the sword even though they cannot use it. Once in their possession, they will do anything to keep it, including attacking other members of their group. While they own the sword, they will use it in combat regardless of class and religious restrictions. They sword does 3d6 cold damage. When not using the sword, the character will insist on only using magic orientated around cold. While there might be other ways to remove the curse, death is the only know way to totally remove the curse. It is said the only way to destroy the sword is to throw it into a lava pool of an active volcano.

item.name: Sovereign Glue
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This is the rightful monarch of all other glue, currently deposed by its wicked uncle. It bears itself regally and will not suffer you to open or use it.

item.name: Simple Weapon Charms
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Small pewter charm in the shape of either a sword, a hammer, or a bow.

{@bold Features} (GM): Made to protect the wielder from damage associated with the type of charm. Holds 2 charges. As a reaction upon being hit by an attack, you can spend 1 charge to activate this item and reduce the type of damage associated with your charm to 0. Sword: slashing, hammer: bludgeoning, bow: piercing. This items charges regenerate once per week. If this item loses all of its charges, it shatters and is destroyed.

item.name: Simple Weapon Charms, minor
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Small pewter charm in the shape of either a sword, a hammer, or a bow.

{@bold Features} (GM): Made to protect the wielder from damage associated with the type of charm. Holds 2 charges. As a reaction upon being hit by an attack, you can spend 1 charge to activate this item and reduce the type of damage associated with your charm to 0. Sword: slashing, hammer: bludgeoning, bow: piercing. When this item loses all of its charges, it shatters and is destroyed.

item.name: Staff of Burning Hands
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Attempting to invoke the power of this fire-blackened ash staff will result in the holder suffering 1d3 Fire damage, as it grows white hot for a moment.

item.name: Stabbing Boots
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): These boots look identical to caltrop boots.

{@bold Features} (GM): When the command word is used the square the user is standing in, along with all adjacent squares, is filled with caltrops before the boots vanish. The wearer immediately takes 1d6 piercing damage and no longer has any footwear.

item.name: Thirty-nine and a half foot pole of touching
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A 39.5 ft pole which can be used to deliver touch attacks. Made of a special magic wood, its colored white with red stripes and has an ornate hand on the end that looks like a four-fingered white glove. It’s not particularly straight or stiff and the user takes a -5 penalty to touch attacks with it.

item.name: Turntoad
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A toad sized figuring of a toad.
{@bold Features} (GM): Whenever this is put on firm ground somewhere, it turns around. Faint transmutation.

item.name: Tome of Recording
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The tome, once the command phrase is spoken, will make a written record all things spoken in its native language that occur in its presence (usually 20ft). The book can hold about 10 total hours worth of conversations, (The GM will need to determine the frequency of conversation).  Once the book is filled its used.

item.name: Tear of the Hamadryad
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This teardrop-shaped piece of smooth amber is warm to the touch and grants its bearer a feeling of calmness and serenity.
{@bold Features} (GM): Property: Once per day, while clutching the tear of the hamadryad, you gain a 1d4 bonus to any saving throw or ability check.

item.name: Tongue Ring
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This is a tongue ring/stud, that once in place allows the creature to gain proficiency of the languages of another creature. To do this you must Kiss that creature (French/Deep kiss)

item.name: Ugly Socks
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A pair of musty, old, knitted socks.
{@bold Features} (GM): When wearing these, you are cannot be exhausted by cold weather.

item.name: Wand of Shocking Grasp
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Often in a Wand form, this can however be a glove guantlet or the like.  Attempting to invoke the power of this copper wand will result in the holder suffering 1d3 Electricity damage as the wand jolts its holder with electricity. Charges (4), regains d3 charges per day.

item.name: Wand of Teleportation
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Upon a successful use of this wand it teleports to the designated location as normal by the Dimension Door spell or Teleport spell (wielder's option). It does not however, take the wielder with it. Any items attached to the wand, or markings made on it, are left behind when it teleports. An Identify spell will not relate this without an Arcana Check of 25+.  It Holds 4 charges and restores 1 (1d4-1) charges each day.

item.name: Wand of Tautologies
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When you use this wand, this wand becomes used

item.name: Wineskin of Infinite Water
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The wineskin each day at a random time, produces 4 gallons of Water.  This isn't on command, and if the bag is even partially full, the cork either Pop's out or it silently leaks immediately - often soaking back and pants, or damaging things in the container with it.

item.name: Bunyan's Belt
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When worn, causes an enormous, bushy black beard to appear on the wearer’s face.

item.name: Belt of Tightening
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Every time you put this belt on, all of your clothes permanently shrink a fraction of a millimeter. The effect is compound.

item.name: Boots of Walking
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The wearer of the boots cannot run, nor can he take a double move action, and takes disadvantage on acrobatics. These boots are made for walkin', and that's just what they'll do.

item.name: Belt of Pants
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This belt creates illusory pants on the wearer. The wearer can suppress the illusion at will

item.name: Belt of Unbathed Breath
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When worn around the waist, allows the user to breathe underwater. Does not function when wet.

item.name: Boots of Levitation
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): These boots levitate a few inches off the ground when not worn.

item.name: Boots of Stylishness
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Knee high black boots that are always clean and shiny.
{@bold Features} (GM): They never take in water, thus feet are always dry.

item.name: Bullying Gloves
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): At random intervals, these gloves instil the wearer with a near-irresistible urge to hit themselves.

item.name: Book of Curses
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A leather bound tome with a stap to keep it closed.

{@bold Features} (GM): When opened, the book verbally berates anyone in the immediate vicinity, calling into question their combat ability, intellect, personal hygiene, lineage and profession of their mothers, and other delightful insults. Once closed the book continues shouting (although it is muffled) until placed inside a bag or some other similar container for 1d4+1 minutes and ignored. Replying to the book in any other way causes the insults to get louder and more childish the more time you spend replying to it.

item.name: Book of Exalted Deeds
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Contains a listing of some of the finest houses ever sold and the specifics of the titles to the properties.

item.name: Book on Confusion
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The letters in this book always appear to be upside down, even if viewed from different directions at the same time. The book is a bad novel about zombies.

item.name: Bagpipe of Stealth
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Grants the user invisibility as long as it is being played

item.name: Banana Walkie-Talkies
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A banana made of a light ceramic with small holes in the form of circle on the inside curve at both ends.

{@bold Features} (GM): There exist two, and only two, of these items in the world. One of which is possessed by a cranky and lonely half-orc. It appears to be an innocuous wooden banana with a coat of faded yellow paint. When an end (doesn't matter which one) is placed against your ear, you can hear a ringing followed by a *click* and a half-orc yelling at you for waking him up at this ungodly hour. If you drop the banana or “hang up,” the call ends. If you stay and listen, the half-orc will yell at you, call out obscenities, and start going on about his daily problems and mishaps in his love life. Every so often (2% chance/day), the banana will ring while you are sleeping and the half-orc will want to talk to you about his problems.

item.name: Case of the Litigator
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Translates any document placed in the case into legal jargon; non-reversible. Does not confer the ability to understand legal jargon.

item.name: Centurybloom Tree Seeds
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A seed, roughly the size of acorn

{@bold Features} (GM): These seeds grow into trees in a few months. It generates 90 pieces of fruit per month. Each fruit equals a medium or small creature a full day's rations, and provide them 10 temporary hit pointsn (until their first rest)

item.name: Corpsehunter’s Medallion
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The amulet is made from the skulls of grave rats or perhaps from scrimshawed bones of the ignoble dead.
{@bold Features} (GM): While wearing this amulet the wearer has resistance to Necrotic damage.

item.name: Courtier's Bane
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A crystal wine glass.

{@bold Features} (GM): When the command word is spoken, this turns the wine it contains into poison. Another command word changes the wine into a potion of healing. It can only transform wine once per day.

item.name: Coldsnap
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A trinket is blue in color with icicle carvings - it often appears as a ring, but sometimes appears as an amulet.

{@bold Features} (GM): As a bonus action you can activate Coldsnap to give yourself an aura of cold that emits up to a radius of 10 feet. Any creatures (friend or foe) within the radius are dealt 1d4 points of cold damage at the beginning of each of their turns. This aura always lasts 2 hours, and during that time you will take double damage from all fire damage. While the aura is active, Coldsnap cannot be removed by any means, but you are immune to cold weather.

item.name: Comb of Spider Summoning
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A dark purple comb with spiderweb designs on it.
{@bold Features} (GM): Once per day the wielder may speak the command word of this item and cause it to erupt with a swarm of spiders.

item.name: Compacting Hammer
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A large double headed-hammer, garishly decorate with colorful patterns that make it look childish and a bit whimsical.

{@bold Features} (GM): The force imparted by it is multiplied, but is spread around the surface of a struck object facing inward. When attempting to sunder a structure it deals a minimum of 2 points of damage with each successful hit.

item.name: Crystal of Death Scrying
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When used, the Crystal can bring up the final moments of a creature's death (last minute of such).  Sounds will be indistinct. The user must make a CHARISMA save against DC 16, or be Stunned for a minute in horror/revulsion and bleed from their eyes and ears (no damage).

item.name: Cube of Watery Force
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A dark blue transparent glass cube.

{@bold Features} (GM): Once per day you may activate this item and create 10x10 cube of water centered on yourself. When you do, you cast the spell Waterbreathing on yourself instantaneously, without it's components, and without using a spell slot. Creatures within 10 feet of you must pass a DC 14 CON save or take 6d6 force damage, or half as much on a successful save. This area counts as difficult terrain, and projectiles cannot pass through this area. Creatures starting their turn in this area must succeed on a DC 14 CON save or take 4d4 force damage. This effect dissipitates at the start of your 3rd turn after activating this item.  All ranged attacks are at disadvantage, and while active the user is immune to fire damage.

item.name: Case of Infinite Bolts
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This small case looks like Crossbow-Bolt-Case, but is much smaller since it only holds one bolt. When the bolt is removed and used as part of a ranged attack (with a crossbow), upon impact the bolt will deal normal damage, and then reappear within the case! If the bolt is removed from the case and not used within 5 minutes itwill disappear and reappear back in the case. The bolt itself has an additional magical enchantment that can randomly appear; whenever the bolt is removed from the case, roll a 1d20 and consult the chart from notes. If the bolt is placed back into the case (or it magically reappears in the case), it loses its additional magic enchantment.

entries.caption: Case Pull Request
rows: Advantage on next ranged attack with this bolt
Bolt deals double damage (x3 damage on a critical hit)

item.name: Chair of Steadiness
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This chair can be moved but cannot be tipped over by anything less than a DC 35 Strength check.

item.name: Courtier's Scroll
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This scroll can be challenging to create as it’s much smaller than most, and is meant to be concealed within a hand. Its for those suitors with a magic flair and a bit of extra pocket change that are unable to master the magic arts themselves. When held in a fist and squeezed at arms length from the body it erupts into an eloquent bouquet complete with sparkling effects. The exact flower that are created are usually being chosen by the scroll maker. It also has a small arrow pointing to the direction the blossoms will emerge, DC 15 perception to spot. On a fail roll a d4, even is flowers up, odds is flowers down.

item.name: Cape of Resistance
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When this item is placed on any living thing it somehow manages to fall off, untie itself, slip past the owner’s neck entirely, or otherwise avoid being worn.

item.name: Cloak of Displacement, Minor
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This item appears to be a normal cloak, but when worn by a character its magical properties distort and warp reality. When any attack is made against the wearer the cloak has a 20% chance of falling off, no matter how it is secured.

item.name: Chime of Interruption
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This instrument can be struck once every round, which takes a standard action. On any round the chime is activated the user may ready one action without spending an action to do so.

item.name: Cursing Ring
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Receive advantage on Intimidation checks, but character is required to use profanity in every sentence or take a point of psychic damage!

item.name: Cymbal of Symbols
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This musical instrument enables the user to comprehend dead languages, but only while they are deafened by noise.

item.name: Caltrop Boots
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): These boots are a little uncomfortable, but have thickened, hardened soles.

{@bold Features} (GM): The wearer does not take damage from caltrops or difficult terrain. Once per day, upon saying a command word, the boots will fill every square the wearer passes through for one round with caltrops (so someone with a speed of 30 feet would fill all the squares they move through, including their starting square but not the square they finish their movement in).

item.name: Cloak of Guarding
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The cloak protects the wearer granting them reduction of 2 damage per ranged attack. After 25 points of damage the Cloak is destroyed. Mending Repairs the cloak

item.name: Change Purse
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A cloth coin purse.

{@bold Features} (GM): Placing coins or a single gemstone into the purse will convert the coins to the highest coin equivlence. or the Gemstone to its value in coins.  Putting 10 gold, will result in the purse changing them into a single platinum piece. Putting 100 copper (it cannot hold more than 100 coins at time) will produce 1 Gold piece.

item.name: Dave
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This small, unremarkable figurine of a gnome.
{@bold Features} (GM): The Statue cannot be called anything but Charles. No other name will leave the lips of the speaker. It has no other powers.

item.name: Death's Mirror
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Made from woven lead and silver, these rings always seem to fit on the hand’s smallest finger.

{@bold Features} (GM): As the moon is a dull reflection of the sun’s glory, so too is the power within this ring merely an imitation of the healing energies that can bestow true life. The wearer can activate this ring three times per day as a bonus action to cast false life on themselves. This ring acts as a 2nd-level spell slot, granting 1d4 + 9 hit points.

item.name: Darkglobe
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This small sphere of thick glass weighs 1 pound with trails wisps of dark odorless smoke that seems to drip from it.

{@bold Features} (GM): It's a reversed Driftglobe that emits darkness instead of light.   It would be useful to Warlocks with Devil's Sight, Way of Shadow Monks, Gloomstalker Rangers, Shadow Sorcerers, races with sunlight sensitivity, and really anyone who likes hiding.  Even though it is roughly the same power level as Driftglobe (Darkness is level 2 vs level 3 for Daylight, but can potentially be cast more often) I added attunement and raised the rarity because of how useful it would be for some characters.

item.name: Dust of Disability
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): From now on you roll a specific Saving Throw (Constitution, Strength, etc) with disadvantage once per day if at all.

item.name: Decanter of Endless Air
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A stoppered flask, that rings empty when sounded. (it is also found as a set of Bellows).

{@bold Features} (GM): The decanter weighs 2 pounds.You can use an bonus action to remove the stopper and speak one of three command words, whereupon an amount of fresh breathable air billows out of the item. The gust stops at the start of your next turn. Choose from the following options: “Breeze” produces the effect of a Gust of  Wind spell for 1 round. (10 miles per hour); “Gust” produces the efffect of a Warding Wind Spell for up to 1 minute in a 30ft Cone you may shift as a reaction. (20 miles per hour); “Hurricane” produces winds up to 50 miles per hour in cone 60ft long while holding the item as a reaction you can aim the torrent at a creature(s) you can see within 60 feet of you, the cone is considered difficult terrain, ranged martial attacks passing through the area have a -10 penalty. Targets in the area are pushed back 10 feet and must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or take 2d4 bludgeoning damage and fall Prone. At the start of their turn every creature in the area makes a new save. (Creatures catagory Large or larger save at advantage. Instead of a creature, you can target an object that isn’t being worn or carried and that weighs no more than 200 pounds. The object is either knocked over or pushed up to 30 feet away from you.

item.name: Dehydrated Water
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This white powder, when added to water will make water.  (The Rare version (370gp) of this will actually work - creating an additional 50ft cube of water (Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 4d8 bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone - if not prepared for the result)

item.name: Elixir of Sneaking
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Sloshing or shaking this pale green liquid in its vial produces no sound.
{@bold Features} (GM): For 1 hour after you drink the elixir, you have advantage on any Dexterity (Stealth) check if you move half your speed or more on the same turn.

item.name: Escape Rope
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A length of Rope which when fed out will create a Rope Trick 1/day

item.name: Echo Jar
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): speak into it and it repeats what you said for the next 6 seconds

item.name: Elven Moonlit Wedding Platter
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This platter is commonly given  as a wedding present among wood elves. When placed in direct moonlight the plate will be magically filled with food. Each plate has a different magical food that it summons, dessert, fruit, meat and cheese are all very common. In fact, wood elves rarely eat meat that isn't summoned from one of these plates, as they find the act of killing an animal to eat distasteful.

Each plate can only summon food once per night, and the food must be eaten in the vicinity of the platter, any food brought too far away from the platter will vanish. If the food is eaten it provides normal sustenance, and is very delicious. The more expensive and well-crafted the platter, the better tasting the food.
It is rare for a non-elf to carry one of these plates, and if one were to come into legitimate possession of one, they could count themselves among the elf-friends.

item.name: Empty Jar
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This appears to be a glass jar that is empty to all senses (if shaken, nothing rattles around).

{@bold Features} (GM): The contents of the jar are visible only when one looks into the top while the lid is off. The jar stores 120 cubic inches of materials none of which can be greater than 6 inches in length and 4 inches in width. The Jar's weight does not change when materials are added or removed.

item.name: Elixir of Hiding
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This cloudy gray liquid is shot through with streaks of black.

{@bold Features} (GM): For 1 hour after you drink the elixir, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. While the potion’s magic is in effect, you can use a bonus action to make a single attempt to hide in plain sight, allowing you to take the Hide action even against a creature that can see you clearly. You have advantage on your Dexterity (Stealth) check when you hide in plain sight, after which the potion’s magic ends.

item.name: Ferryman’s Coins
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A couple of unfamiliar copper penny.

{@bold Features} (GM): It’s custom in many faiths to weight a corpse’s eyes with pennies so they have a fee to pay the ferryman when he comes to row them across death’s river to the afterlife. Ferryman’s coins, though, ensure the body stays in the ground regardless of the spirit’s destination. These coins, which feature a death’s head on one side, and a lock and chain on the other, prevent a corpse from being raised as any kind of undead. The coins, once they are placed on a corpse’s closed lids and activated with a simple prayer, cannot be removed unless the person is resurrected (in which case they simply fall away), or someone makes a DC 15 Strength check to remove them. Yanking the coins away does no damage to the corpse.

item.name: Forever Lasting Gobstopper
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A wine bottle cork stopper of copper and silver.

{@bold Features} (GM): This wine bottle cork has an etching of a goblin at the time sticking out it's tongue, and is always found with a corked to a small vile (or jar) of liquid. When the cork is removed from the bottle and held above your head, it causes all goblins in a 30-foot radius to take notice from the foul stench that only they can smell. Every goblin affected this way must make a Constitution Save (DC 18), or begin to begin to vomit (on a failed save they are unable to take any actions on their next turn and all attacks against them are with Advantage). Once the goblin has recovered (or succeeded it save), it becomes immune to the Gobstopper's effects for one day. Note that the bottle itself is full of water, and must be refilled with fresh water before using the Gobstopper again.

item.name: Greater Staff of Random Summoning
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Summons a random creature at a random place. You could be summoning a giant Ogre on the other side of the globe for all you know.

item.name: Goggles of Improved Identify
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Goggles made of Pearl, and having a pearlescent lens.
{@bold Features} (GM): For each level the character as they remain on, new features develop with the googles.

{@note Once the player has leveled up with them attuned, they can only be removed by remove curse spell from very high level (12+) cleric}. An {@spell Identify} spell will only result in telling the caster that the googles help give more information when worn.

rows: Spellcasters no longer need a pearl to cast {@spell Identify}, if they know the spell. If they do not, its added to their memorized spell list. If they are not spell casters, +2 to {@skill Investigation} checks.

Passive {@skill Perception} suffers -5 penalty; -1 Charisma. Spellcasters and NonSpellcasters now cast Identify as Ritual in 10 minutes, and will see auras depicting any spell effects on targets being viewed (Use Arcana Check DC 10+Spell level to determine the spell's name/nature). Lables appear on things they've investigated or used the goggles upon.

Concentration Checks are at disadvantage, and an additional -1 to Charisma. Mundane labels appear on all items based off the wielder's knowledge. Dark Vision is granted to the wielder, as well as a “zoom” feature (In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.)
Lose any Dexterity bonus to AC. Zoom is uncontrollable and Field of Vision becomes extremely narrow, the wielder can no longer read things within 10ft of themself.

Any Concentration spells must be checked for EACH round regardless of being damaged. If the wielder stares at an thing for short rest the ticker will, over the period of the short rest, give you benefits of {@spell Legend Lore}

The wielder may not remove the googels from their eyes any longer lest the wielder becomes {@condition blinded}, permanently (requires a heal to return ANY vision, but even so the character's visions is 1/2 their natural vision, and always as if lightly obscured. For the next 10 minutes, you have truesight out to 120 feet once per day per each additional level gained from this point forward.

item.name: Goldgobbler
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing):  A standard gold coin

{@bold Features} (GM): After each rest (short or long) it 'gobbles' one Platinium or gold coin its placed among, if no gold or platinium coins are with it, it 'gobbles' 10gp of value from a golden piece of jewelry or other golden object per rest. (Magical Items lose their ability when 20% of its value has been lost)

item.name: GrimLight
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This is a cube usually 2 inches in dimension.

{@bold Features} (GM): The cube is attuned by having it with you while you complete a long rest. The cube provides up to 40ft of bright light, and an additional 40ft of dim.  The light's brightness (radius) and color can be modified by the creature to which it is attuned by their mental command, while they are within 120ft of the cube (or it one of cluster is within 120ft of another). This item can be “chain” attuned. which is to state that the item using an attunuation slot with the creature, but if you attuned multiple Grimlights, you may have them all use the same slot - however; if you do this, any command given is shared by the cluster (Provided its within 120ft of another cube).  If the creature wishes they can use another attunement slot for another GrimLIght, and command that Cube or Cluster Separately.

item.name: Glass of Non-Allergic Water Creation
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): An average glass or mug.
{@bold Features} (GM): When a user casts Create Water inside this glass, any human is not allergic to that water.

item.name: Glasses
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The is appears as head bandages, goggles, glasses or the like. When when worn over the eyes {@condition blinded|blinds} you, but also give you blindsight 15’.

item.name: Glove of clapping
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A single leather glove.
{@bold Features} (GM): When worn, a command word causes it to make a clapping noise.

item.name: Gloves of Blink
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): These gloves have 3 charges. While you wear these gloves, it projects an illusion that makes you appear to be standing in a place near your actual location, causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.  If you take damage, the property ceases to function until the start of your next turn. This property is suppressed while you are incapacitated, restrained, or otherwise unable to move. In addition, if you have at least one hand free, you may use a bonus action to expend 1 charge to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see. The gloves regain {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn

item.name: Gag Crossbow
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A Massive and obviously magical heavy crossbow with multiple bolts marked with icons for balls of fire in a hopper that apparently feeds the crossbow automatically.

{@bold Features} (GM): This +4 Shocking Burst Vampiric Wounding Heavy Crossbow appears to be a weapon of great strength, loaded with a dozen bolts each somehow infused with a Maximized Fireball. When one attempts to fire it, though, the only reaction is a 'pthbbbt!' noise and a white flag inscribed “Bang!” that pops out of the stock.

item.name: Gloves of Tinkering
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Wearing the gloves will make you able to almost repair any broken item over the period of 1 hour. However, you will always end up with pieces from the item that don't seem to fit anywhere.

item.name: Hair-Broach of Protection
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This broach when worn grants its weilder a lusterous, managable hair.

item.name: Hangman's Noose
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A hemp noose, weathered and frayed at the ends.

{@bold Features} (GM): No sane man would willingly put a noose around his neck, but certain hemp ropes used in the execution of final justice possess the power to affect those beyond the reach of normal magics. When held in your hand you may 3 times per day, as an action, cast hold person. Unlike the standard version of this spell, though, the magic of the Handman’s Noose only affects undead.

item.name: Headband of Quiet Intellect
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Works as a Headband of Intellect, but.. when worn the wearer become mute.

item.name: Heroic Mufflers
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A set of earmuffs.
{@bold Features} (GM): These cool-looking earmuffs provide a +2 on saves vs. spells that deal Thunder damage. ((Disadvantage on hearing based perception checks))

item.name: Homunculus Totem
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A small black doll roughly shaped like a person made from twine.
{@bold Features} (GM): When your HP is reduced to 0 while in possession of this item, the totem crumbles to ashes and you are stabilized and regain 15HP

item.name: Horn of Sneaking
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): While blowing on this horn full blast, the user's footsteps will never be heard.

item.name: Halberd of Berry Picking
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This halberd was designed to get berries from high trees. When used to harm a living thing, it will always miss. When used to harvest gain advantage on amounts harvested

item.name: Helm of Courage
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Grants +1 AC each round its weilder encourages another character (“Good Job!” “Nice Shot!” “You can do it!”)

item.name: Indestructible Notebook of Memories
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This otherwise normal notepad of normal notepad size cannot be damaged or destroyed, and anything written in it cannot be obscured or defaced. It also has unlimited pages despite its finite size. However, the data it holds only lasts as long as the writer independently remembers it, and decays in exact proportion to the relevant memories. Remember who and when, but not where? Then the words describing the location in that particular entry are the only ones gone.

item.name: Idol of the Running Man
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A small clay statue of a running warrior.

{@bold Features} (GM): This small clay statue of a running warrior is anything but -- it's as hard as cold steel but light as wood. When kept in your inventory, as a bonus action you can make a dash for an increase of speed 20 feet (4 squares); you must declare this at the beginning of your turn. Once the burst of speed is used, the Idol of the Running Man cannot be used this way again for 24 hours.

item.name: Immovable rod (alternate)
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When the button on this artifact is pressed in, the holder's opinions solidify and they become impossible to convince.

item.name: Kaila's Dragon Mask
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): An intimidating metal mask in the likeness of a blue dragon.

{@bold Features} (GM): Grants you +1 to intimidation. Holds charges equal to the wielders spellcasting ability modifier. As a reaction you can spend 1 charge when being targeted by a melee attack to emit a shockwave of an energy type. Doing so, you impose disadvantage on the creature targeting you with a melee attack, and if they still strike, they must succeed on a DC 16 DEX save or take 4d4 damage (The type of which is determined by the dragon's type.)

item.name: Kaila’s Morpher
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A thick black wristband made from leather with 4 concentric circles, each with inlaid runes.

{@bold Features} (GM): The circles can be aligned to form a personal teleportation circle. Holds 1 charge. You may spend 1 charge and activate this item by properly aligning the rings to match the teleportation circle they correspond to. Upon activation, you may cast the spell Teleportation Circle as an action, without consuming a spell slot or using vocal, somatic, or material components, but you may only designate a location connected to the Morpher. The Morpher can store up to 4 teleportation circles to connect to. This item regains it’s charge at dawn the next day, or by being charged with a 5th level spell slot.

item.name: Kick Me
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A golden chain with a large Ruby pendant. Looking at it gives you a impression of strong protections.
{@bold Features} (GM): When this necklace is worn, all others see it as a steel chain, and furthermore see a placard reading “Kick Me” on the wearer’s back.

item.name: King Sadam's Circlet
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A tarnished Golden Circlet with a few ornate stones in settings, most of its settings are empty.
{@bold Features} (GM): Upon wearing it becomes cursed with Insatiable Greed and gold turns to lead in hands

item.name: Key of Opening
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing):  A golden key with the symbol of a lock engraved along the length.
{@bold Features} (GM): The key opens any lock, but only once. Afterwards it breaks.

item.name: Long Breath
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Not lost on the (admittedly few) senior priests and clerics who appreciate irony amongst those of the Hall of Oaths, the church of the Valiant is that one of their most sacred relics should be so humble when their most public followers and champions should appear so regal in their adornment. The Breath is a scarf of simple worn cloth, undyed and of common cotton. Attuning to it requires a careful seven-day series of blessings that must be administered by a holy of a LG temple and willingly so. A hand is wrapped in the scarf for a day of prayer, the next day the other hand is wrapped for another day of prayer, then each foot, then held to the chest, then the head, and on the last day it is worn about the neck. Once attuned, the wearer may use its special ability once, it recharges this ability once per month when they speak a short prayer to the LG gods for their blessing after a long rest. When activated (requiring one action), the DM rolls 1d4 (this is the “Duration” number) and records the number on a piece of paper or index card to the side, face down. The wearer may not take a bonus action, may move only half their base movement (if they have not yet moved), and may not take a reaction until the beginning of their next turn. In the time between now and then, the world slows (from the wearer’s point of view) until it virtually stops. The Count starts at 0. At the start of their next, if the Duration is less than the Count, the world surges back to its proper time and the wearer takes a number of points of Exhaustion equal to the Duration + 1, they may take their turn as normal. If this is not the case (the DM is the one checking), then they must decide to continue the Long Breath–the great slowing of the world–or not. If they choose to not continue it then reveal the Duration number. If the Duration number higher than the Count, the Breath ends and the world catches up and they may take their turn as normal. If the Duration is equal to the Count, the world snaps back abruptly and the wearer takes 1 exhaustion, but may continue their turn as normal otherwise. The PC may take their turn as normal, but their movement is halved and they may not take Reactions. At the end of their turn, raise the Count by 1. All other turns, counts, durations, and actions (and reactions) by all other parties are suspended (as they are frozen in time). This includes progress on poisons or spell effects. The wearer starts another turn (begin the “at the start of their next turn” sequence with the DM checking if the Duration is less than the Count…” and on).

item.name: Lucifon's Marvelous Plot Engine
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This diabolical engine of torment and despair was once a simple, innocent Apparatus of Kwalish. Now, due to mystic enhancements placed upon it by the demon-artificer Lucifon, it believes itself to be a cocker spaniel and every 10d10 days it will choose a new 'master' to follow around at random from the people within 1 mile of it. While following a 'master', it will attempt to remain within 5' of that person at all times, except when it sees an outhouse (which it immediately attacks until destroyed), clean laundry (it will consume any left sock, stocking, or 1/2 of a pair of hose therein), or mailman (what is done to mailmen is best left unsaid). At night, while the 'master' is sleeping, the confused Apparatus of Kwalish will attempt to 'curl up on its master's lap' - this consists of it circling around that person three times, walking until it is directly over top of them, and then retracting all limbs/protrusions simultaneously in order to land directly on top of them (at which point it is merely a 1 ton cylander of knobly steel).

item.name: Lesser Everfull Purse
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): If you place one gold piece in the purse, the next day 10 Silver Pieces will be in it. If you place a silver, the next day 10 copper pieces will be in it. Only works with single coins.

item.name: Movable rod
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Functions similarly to an immovable rod, but doesn't take nearly as much effort to move (DC 12 STR check or 80 pounds of pressure).

item.name: Murder Dagger
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Weapon deals no damage, but the target is instead hounded by a pack of crows for that many hours.

item.name: Martyr Glass
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When shattered, this crystal wineglass casts bless on all within 20 feet. It can be used in a ceremony where a solemn oath is sworn. The person who speaks the oath gains +1 on ability checks to accomplish the oath, once the oath is fufilled the bonus is lost. If the Oath is nebulous or overly difficult (GM's call - but the oath should be accomplishable within the next week) - the glass shatters and everyone within 20feet (including the oath maker), suffers the effect of a bane.

item.name: Mask of the RedDevil
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A crimson half mask with that does not have opening for the eyes.

{@bold Features} (GM): Upon donning this crimson mask you are blinded (PHB p 290). You gain advantage on all checks involving listening and gain Tremorsense 60’ radius. If you remove the mask, you remain blinded until completing a long rest.

item.name: Mage's Coaster
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When placed on a table or similar surface, this ornate wooden coaster will automatically scoot underneath a mug, cup, or bottle placed on that surface.

item.name: Mantle of Awe
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): On entering a room with the mantle in one's possession, a flock of doves fly through the doorway from behind you, a fanfare plays and an angelic chorus can be heard singing a verse. The larger the room, the more impressive the effect (more doves, longer angelic chorus). Created for a noble who wished to make a good impression at a party. Has the unfortunate effect of activating every time one enters a room. Every room. This fact was discovered by a scoundrel who robbed the original owner and tried (failing) to escape.

item.name: Mask of Change Appearance
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This mask reqspacesembles a certain humanoid creature. The creature is chosen by the DM, or can be determined randomly by rolling on the table below. Using an action you can put on this mask to gain the appearance of the creature it resembles. Your statistics remain the same.

item.name: Mask of Death
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When placed upon a corpse the mask will ask a person to place their hand in the corpse's mouth. The mask will then take deal 10% MAX HP, and age the user 5% of the hand's owner's life expectancy. The Mask will the work as if a Speak with Dead has been cast on the Corpse, no limit on number of times it can be enacted, but each time it demands to be fed.

item.name: Mask of Movement
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Orange wooden fox mask.
{@bold Features} (GM): Adds 5 to your movement speed, and once per day you can take the dodge action as a bonus action and gain +5 movement until the end of the round.

item.name: Mask of the Beast
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This wooden mask is shaped in the likeness of a beast's visage.
{@bold Features} (GM): While wearing the mask you can expend 1 charge and use the mask to cast the animal friendship spell as an action. The mask regains all expended charges at dawn.

item.name: Moonwater Gourd
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The gourd is intricately carved. Inside it are three stones with runes on them.
{@bold Features} (GM):  Each night, the gourd refills itself with water to capacity. Properties are lost if any of the stones are removed or some other liquid is poured into it.

item.name: Mirror of Revealing
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This magic mirror lets you scry directly behind you, or around a nearby corner.

item.name: Mordenkainen's Unfaithful Watchdog
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This small statue of a dog

{@bold Features} (GM): Once animated, runs away from its owner. It however will state it is a Faithful Guard Dog usable once per day. Identify will report this, as will other divination or class abilities. If a arcana check is made while using Identify or other divination spell DC is 25, to determine it is a false protector.

item.name: Mist Beads
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A light blue and black beaded necklace.
{@bold Features} (GM): Fully loaded it Holds 7 light blue beads. You can crush 1 light blue bead in your hand to take the dodge action as a bonus action.

item.name: Monkey Drum
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This palm-sized drum is painted in garish colours.

{@bold Features} (GM): When used, it summons {@dice 1d20} apes that randomly attack everyone in the area for three rounds before vanishing. There is a 5% chance that the drum will summon 1d8 giant apes instead; if this happens, the giant apes do not vanish until everyone in the area is slain or the apes are killed.

item.name: Mud Ring
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This silver ring is encrusted with dark gems; upon inspection the ring itself smells very earthy and sometimes wormy.

{@bold Features} (GM): It contains just 1 charge when found. As an action, you can activate the charge to hurl a ball of mud at any target with a ranged attack (range 30/60). A hit creature becomes muddied and the next attack roll made against it (by anyone) has Advantage. If the mud attack resulted in a Critical Hit, then target also receives a Disadvantage to its next attack roll since it can't see through mud (unless it has other senses to compensate). If the mud attack resulted in a Critical miss, then the ring will turn itself on you and put mud in your face (as if you scored a Critical Hit on yourself). The ring itself can be recharged (maximum of 1 charge) by soaking it in mud for four hours

item.name: Ring of Chameleon Power
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This ring can change colors to match any background, and does so, matching the skin tone of whomever wears it.

item.name: Ring of First Impression
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Wearing the ring will make you able to perform a perfect handshake with the hand wearing it. +1 to persuasion for 10 minutes 1

item.name: Ring of Detect magic
entries: {@bold Features} (GM):  It has 1 charge per dawn. When you use the ring it detects that it itself is magical, makes a noise and turns off.

item.name: Ring of Invisibility, Least
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The ring, upon being worn, becomes invisible. The creatures wearing it does not.

item.name: Ring of Spell Storing
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Upon activation, this ring magically stores the next word spoken by the character. Upon a second activation, the ring spells that word in a loud, clear voice. If the word is difficult to understand, the ring asks, “Definition and Origin, please?”

item.name: Ring of Three Washes
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This plain steel band uses a prestidigitation effect to clean your equipment, three times

item.name: Ring of Acid Immunity
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When worn this makes the wearer immune to hallucinations caused by poisons (also makes you resistant to Phatasmal Killer Spells)

item.name: Ring of Bureaucratic Wizardry
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When a wizard casts any spell while wearing the ring, a sheaf of papers and a quill pen suddenly appear in his hand. The papers are forms that must be filled out in triplicate explaining the effects of the spell, why the wizard wishes to cast it, whether it is for business or pleasure, and so on. The forms must be filled out before the effects of the spell will occur. The higher the level of the spell cast, the more complicated the forms become. Filling out the forms requires one round per level of spell.

item.name: Ring of ever spending protection.
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Gives +2 ac but any time you enter a place of business you must buy the most expensive item in the building. There is no permanent way to remove curse. The ring can only be removed once someone else has accepted it as a gift and puts it on. If the ring is not put on by the nights rise the next day by new owner it reappears on the last curse person.

item.name: Ring Mail of Three Wishes
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This armor is Leather Armor with heavy rings sewn into it.

{@bold Features} (GM):  The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Three rings across the chest are made of brilliant gold that sheds dim light similar to daybreak. (When you are hit by a melee or ranged attack while wearing this armor, you can use your reaction to wish that you hadn't been hit. The attack deals no damage, but the armor class provided by the armor decreases by 1. After the third wish, the armor's rings vanish and it becomes nonmagical leather armor.)
{@Note The armor counts as Medium armor but is a heavy Leather armor which grants AC 15.

item.name: Ring of Contrainess
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Upon wearing this ring the character immediately has an attunement slot taken, and becomes argumentative and contrary. If the party wishes to go left, they want to go right. This is a RP based cursed item, and cannot be removed until the character has a remove curse placed upon them.  For game mechanics, this person has disadvantage on all Charisma based ability/skill checks and suffers 2d6 Damage to Charisma after each long rest. In this case a creature with 0 or less Charisma refuses to get out of bed.

item.name: Robe of Blending
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Any inanimate fruit or vegetable placed into these robes will be puréed into a fine pulp.

item.name: Ring of Haggling
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Golden ring with fig tree designs. Once per day you may activate this item by tapping it with a fingertip. When activated, any person within 10 feet of the wielder must make a wisdom save with a DC of 16 or be put under the rings spell. Creatures influenced by the ring have disadvantage on persuasion contests against the wielder. Creatures who pass the save are unaware of the rings influence. This item regains its charge at dawn the next day.
